um and so when you are sending emails there's actually there's three uh things that
um you absolutely need to send for amp HTML emails uh so this spfdkim and dmarc
uh so your email sender must pass all three of these in order to send an amp HTML an amp email so SPF is a DNS record
that specifies the IP addresses that can send mail on behalf of a domain
um so this allows a mailbox to say hey I got this email
um and it came from this IP address I'm going to check this DNS entry and and
see if it was allowed to send it to me if it wasn't it's going to be much as as a Spam or it's going to be more suspicious
uh dkim is a way to sign the content of an email that can be confirmed by the mailbox so again it's another DNS record
in this case it has a public key in it that can be used to um uh confirm a signature on the content
of the email so this shows that the email hasn't been altered since leaving the the mailbox and arrived since
leaving the mail sender and arriving in the Inbox and then dmarc uh kind of
combines um or Builds on top of those two uh to actually provide a way for the domain
owners to understand who's sending email on their behalf so if an email then if
an email fails SPF or dkim your dmarc DNS uh record will say what
to do with that so you can say do nothing whatever you can make your own decision but you can also say quarantine
so put it into spam or just block it so if you are convinced that somebody else
is sending this email on your behalf you can tell a mailbox that's looking up a dmarc record just not to not to ever put
this in an inbox uh it's not from you you can also get reports so you can set
up email addresses within that dmac record to tell a mailbox what to do to tell mailbox to send reports about these
emails back to you so you can understand what's going on
